page.title: 05WOODHOUSE FARM.
page.content: {Woodhouse Farm,}a {mixed farm}of 170 acres owned by Mr.& Mrs.Robinson, was once part of the Earl of Dudley's large estate. They keep Hereford & Friesian cattle which are bought from Kidderminster Market at 16 months and fattened up for beef. 110 Suffolk Cross Clun ewes are bought in Autumn to lamb in Spring then resold at Kidderminster. Barley,spring and winter wheat,sugar beet and hay are grown in a sandy very stoney soil not helped by the lack of a natural source of water. These crops have to be sprayed at a cost of Â£8,000 per year.Machinery shared with relatives,includes a Â£4,000 plough,2 Ford tractors,a turbo tiller,a corn drill,combine harvester,sprayer,manure spreader and a sugar beet driller.
